channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - HP Hero
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2019 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Acting Chief of Staff Mulvaney said it after confirming there was a quid pro quo, but it's the administration's answer to any number of issues swirling around
item.description: A rare press briefing fromÂ a Trump administration official yielded an especially telling line about the Trump presidency: "Get over it."

item.title: Exclusive: Giuliani sought visa for Ukrainian promising dirt on Democrats
item.description: Career diplomat George Kent told congressional investigators in his closed-door testimony this week that Rudy Giuliani asked the State Department and the White House to grant a visa to the former Ukrainian official who Joe Biden had pushed to have removed when he was vice president, according to four people familiar with Kent's testimony.

item.title: 5 key developments in the impeachment inquiry
Tapper: WH saying 'get over' Trump's scandals is standard
item.description: CNN's Jake Tapper analyzes the varying responses the White House has offered to explain President Donald Trump's phone call with the Ukrainian president, following White House chief of staff Mick Mulvaney admitting to, and subsequently backtracking, quid pro quo in the conversation.

item.title: John Kasich calls for Trump's impeachment
item.description: Former Ohio Gov. John Kasich said President Donald Trump should be impeached, a major switch for a former Republican presidential candidate who had previously defended the President.

item.title: Fact check: Trump makes 26 false claims at Texas rally
item.description: President Donald Trump made at least 26 false claims in his 87-minute rally speech in Dallas on Thursday, including an inaccurate declaration that Texas had somehow profited from one of the costliest hurricanes in American history.

item.title: Trump is hanging Israel and Netanyahu out to dry
item.description: With a single stroke, President Donald Trump has effectively brought a newly resurgent and potent triadâSyria, Russia and Iranâto the very doorstep of their declared enemy, Israel, and given aid and comfort to Israel's longtime and persistent foe, Hezbollah, in Lebanon.

item.title: Gabbard responds to Clinton: You are the 'personification of the rot' in Democratic Party
item.description: Former Democratic presidential nominee Hillary Clinton said Thursday the Russians are currently "grooming" a Democrat running in the presidential primary to run as a third-party candidate and champion their interests.

item.title: Energy Department says it won't comply with impeachment subpoena
item.description: Assistant Secretary of Energy Melissa Burnison told the three committees involved in the House impeachment inquiry that the Energy Department is "unable to comply with your request for documents and communications at this time."

item.title: McConnell slams Trump's move ... but doesn't use his name
item.description: Mitch McConnell published a scathing op-ed in the Washington Post criticizing President Donald Trump's decision to pull troops from Syria, however, he didn't use Trump's name in the article.

item.title: Has the White House tainted Barr's investigation of the Russia probe?
item.description: The Justice Department's investigation into the origins of the Russia election interference probe keeps getting unwanted assists from the White House, raising questions of how the department will be able to defend the legitimacy of any of its eventual findings.

item.title: 2014 photo of Trump and indicted Giuliani associate was at Ivanka Trump fashion show
item.description: A March 2014 photograph showing Donald Trump with a recently indicted associate of Rudy Giuliani appears to have been taken at a fashion show hosted by Ivanka Trump at the Trump National Doral in Florida, a CNN KFile review reveals.

item.title: Internet melts down over Pelosi photo
item.description: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi makes a finger-wagging "meltdown" photo her own. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports the internet swoons.

item.title: Cummings' body will lie in state at Capitol
item.description: The body of Rep. Elijah Cummings will lie in state in the National Statuary Hall of the US Capitol next week, the office of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi announced Friday.

item.title: A security guard asked a student to stop calling him the n-word. It cost him his job
item.description: An African American security guard told a student to stop calling him the N-word. It cost him his job.

item.title: A woman who livestreamed crash that killed her sister is out of prison and arrested again
item.description: In 2017, 18-year-old Obdulia Sanchez livestreamed a video as she was driving drunk during a crash that killed her younger sister. She was convicted of vehicular manslaughter and served less than two years in prison. She was released last month.

item.title: Drug companies fail to reach settlement ahead of opioid crisis trial
item.description: Six drug companies accused in thousands of lawsuits over their role in the nation's opioid epidemic failed to reach a settlement with governments across the country, setting the stage for a high-profile trial Monday.

item.title: Mysterious move strips elites of penthouse views
item.description: North Korea has blocked windows in several high-rise buildings in Pyongyang in what experts believe is an attempt to crack down on spying. CNN's Brian Todd reports.

item.title: Driver in fatal Indiana bus stop crash found guilty of homicide
item.description: A 25-year-old Indiana woman was found guilty of reckless homicide in the 2018 deaths of three siblings at a school bus stop in rural Rochester, Indiana, CNN affiliate WNDU reported.

item.title: A man missing for a week is found alive inside his wrecked car
item.description: A Missouri man who'd been missing for a week was found at the bottom of a ravine by a biker.

item.title: Oracle CEO dead at 62
item.description: Mark Hurd, CEO of Oracle and former CEO of Hewlett-Packard, two of Silicon Valley's most storied companies, has died. He was 52.

item.title: See female astronauts make history
item.description: Anderson Cooper speaks with Kathryn Sullivan, the first American woman to perform a spacewalk. Watch "Full Circle" every weeknight at 5pm E.T.

item.title: If you own this phone, remove your screen protector
item.description: Samsung's new high-tech fingerprint reader on the latest Galaxy smartphones has a major flaw: It can be fooled by the residue left by your fingers on a screen protector. The company is warning customers who own the latest Galaxy S10 and Galaxy Note 10 phones to remove their screen protectors until Samsung releases a software update.

item.title: See runners' touching move for teammate who was nearly killed
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper has the heartwarming story of a teen athlete who got back on his feet after a life-threatening accident. Watch "Full Circle" every weeknight at 5pm E.T.

item.title: We asked a hacker to try to steal a CNN tech reporter's data. Here's what happened
item.description: I share, therefore I am.

item.title: Son of 'El Chapo' captured, then quickly released to save lives, officials say
item.description: A bloody, prolonged shootout between Mexican security forces and suspected cartel members in Sinaloa state this week was an intentional â and ultimately abandoned â attempt to capture a son of imprisoned drug lord Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman for extradition to the United States, Mexican officials now say.

item.title: Star actress shares mammogram video
item.description: Actress Jennifer Garner took viewers with her to get a mammogram. She's encouraging other women to get yearly breast cancer screenings.

item.title: Lady Gaga plummets backward off stage
item.description: Lady Gaga may have sung "Edge of Glory" but it was the edge of the stage that proved her undoing during her latest Enigma show in Las Vegas, when she plummeted backward into the crowd.

item.title: Opinion: Just say it: Yes, I'm menstruating
item.description: In a recent unaired, cut-for-time commercial parody on "Saturday Night Live," Phoebe Waller-Bridge asks Aidy Bryant for a tampon, but doesn't want to do the hand-off in their college classroom. Bryant tells her not to worry, because she carries Tampax Secrets: tampons that come wrapped inside "other things you'd rather take out of your bag in public" -- a litany of humorously awful things to take out in public, including dog feces, a dead mouse, a "respectfully folded Confederate flag," and a signed copy of "Mein Kampf." The message here is clear: women are conditioned to be so ashamed and secretive about our periods that we'd rather be seen carrying around a dead mouse than a pad or tampon.

item.title: What Felicity Huffman's prison will be like
item.description: CNN's Alexandra Field takes a look at the facility where actress Felicity Huffman will spend her 14-day jail sentence for her role in the college admissions scandal.

item.title: Get personalized loan options to meet your needs
Meghan Markle, holding back tears, says, 'Not many people have asked if I'm OK'
item.description: Meghan, Duchess of Sussex gave a rare glimpse into her personal life when she admitted that she has struggled to deal with the repercussions of being a new mother in the spotlight.

item.title: Prince Harry says every camera flash takes him back to Diana's death
item.description: Prince Harry has said that every camera flash takes him "straight back" to the death of his mother, Princess Diana, in 1997.

item.title: Prince Harry gets emotional during speech
item.description: The Duke of Sussex teared up as he recounted his wife Duchess Meghan's pregnancy and the birth of the couple's first child, Archie.

item.title: Catherine, Duchess of Cambridge, gives her first TV news interview
item.description: When the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge's five-day tour of Pakistan was announced, the palace said, in a press release, that their focus would be "showcasing Pakistan as it is today -- a dynamic, aspirational and forward-looking nation." Catherine, whose much-examined wardrobe serves as its own showcase, has used her public appearances to highlight Pakistani brands and designers -- which many of those designers are celebrating.

item.title: California earthquakes just caused a major fault line to move
item.description: The Ridgecrest earthquake in July was the strongest to strike Southern California in 20 years. And the main quake, along with more than 100,000 aftershocks, caused a major fault to move for the first time, researchers say.

item.title: The second fall nor'easter in a week could become a bomb cyclone
item.description: While coastal communities in New England are still recovering from costly beach erosion due to last week's coastal storm, another one could be on the way this week -- and it's expected to intensify rapidly.

item.title: Tropical storm warnings issued for Gulf Coast
item.description: An area of storms over the Gulf of Mexico should develop into a tropical or subtropical cyclone before slamming into the US Gulf Coast this weekend, the National Hurricane Center said Friday.

item.title: See 15 years of earthquakes in 45 seconds
item.description: This animation from NOAA uses USGS data to show all of the earthquakes the world has experienced in the first 15 years of the 21st century.

item.title: Here's what was inside a 132-year-old time capsule found in Utah
item.description: This time capsule has been through a lot.

item.title: Scientists freak out over deep sea feast
item.description: A team of researchers stumbled upon a "whale fall," a carcass of a baleen whale, during a live-streamed deep-sea dive. Incredible video shows a wide variety of sea creatures feasting on it.

item.title: She is the most beautiful woman in the world, according to 'science'
item.description: You can't argue with science, right?

item.title: The week in 30 photos
item.description: Take a look at 30 photos of the week from October 11 to October 17.

item.title: Sales of tiny Coke cans are soaring. Here's why
item.description: Good things came in small sizes for Coca-Cola last quarter. The company reported sales that topped forecasts, thanks in part to a double-digit increase in volume for its 7.5-ounce mini cans.

item.title: World's largest brewer says rival tried to steal its secret Bud Light recipe
item.description: Anheuser-Busch InBev has accused rival brewer Miller Coors of obtaining the secret recipes for Bud Light and Michelob Ultra, the latest shot in a long running legal dispute.

item.title: Bees are dying. This startup is trying to save them
item.description: One company wants to help farmers adapt to a world of rapidly declining bee populations.

item.title: Microsoft CEO gets a 66% raise
item.description: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella got a 66% raise in the company's latest fiscal year.

item.title: A letter to Kurdish soldiers from a US military wife
item.description: Dear Kurdish soldiers,

item.title: Jesse Jackson: Elijah Cummings was a man of dignity and discipline
item.description: Elijah Cummings was my beloved brother of more than 40 years. And I miss him already.

item.title: Pelosi isn't all women, but for a moment she was
item.description: We see you, Nancy Pelosi.

item.title: Your impeachment questions, answered
'The Righteous Gemstones' skewers pro-Trump evangelicals' real-life hypocrisies
item.description: On the Gemstone family compound, you can find a McMansion for each branch of the family: patriarch and megachurch leader Eli Gemstone (John Goodman) and his three children with their respective broods. There's a gun range and a militia's worth of private security guards.

item.title: The surgeon general is shirking his job
item.description: Like any top-level White House appointee, Surgeon General Jerome Adams serves at the pleasure of President Donald Trump and owes him some measure of political and institutional loyalty.

item.title: Refi now. Rates as low as 3.04% APR (15yr)!
8 cards charging 0% interest until 2021
Apple's $7 trillion bet
Protester: 'Either we all live peacefully, or no one does'
Street shootout between 'El Chapo's' son and cops
item.description: Police and suspected cartel members engaged in prolonged gun battles in CuliacÃ¡n, Mexico as local authorities pursued the son of former drug lord Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzman.

item.title: At least 62 killed in Afghan mosque explosion
item.description: At least 62 people were killed in an explosion during Friday prayers in a mosque in Nangarhar, Afghanistan, according to a regional spokesman.

item.title: Kurds say Turkey is violating hours-old 'ceasefire' in Syria
item.description: â¢ Trump nonsensically claims other presidents tried to make his Turkey deal for 10 or 15 years

item.title: Swiss banks are charging millionaires to store their money
item.description: Instead of paying interest on deposits, Swiss banks are starting to charge wealthy customers to stash their cash.

item.title: Johnson & Johnson recalls baby powder
item.description: Johnson & Johnson announced on Friday that it's initiating a voluntary recall in the United States of its popular Johnson's Baby Powder due to low levels of asbestos contamination.

item.title: Coasters given out to detect date-rape drugs
item.description: College-aged women are as much as four times more susceptible to sexual violence than women of all ages. With that in mind, the University of New Mexico is hoping some drink coasters can potentially prevent the nightmare of sexual assault for students.

item.title: An Alabama 3-year-old has been missing nearly a week. Police hope a new video helps lead them to her
item.description: An Alabama 3-year-old has been missing for nearly a week and -- though there have been moments of hope and anticipation -- no arrests have been made and there is still no sign of the toddler.

item.title: One dead after a plane carrying a high school swim team goes off the runway in Alaska
item.description: One person has died after a plane carrying 42 people, including a high school swim team, went off an airport runway while trying to land Thursday in Alaska.

item.title: Louvre gets ready for its biggest ever Leonardo exhibition
The story of North Korea's 'Hotel of Doom'
Vivid portraits shine light on Tahiti's 'third gender'
Remember Madonna's cone bra?
